questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: They're hurrying to catch a plane.
They're being led to the airplane.
They're waiting for their luggage.
They're standing in line with their bags.
questions.script:
（A）They're hurrying to catch a plane.
（B）They're being led to the airplane.
（C）They're waiting for their luggage.
（D）They're standing in line with their bags.
（A）他们正在匆匆忙忙赶飞机。
（B）他们正在被带向机场。
（C）他们在等待自己的行李。
（D）他们正拿着包站成一排。
·The people are waiting in a row.
人们正在排队等候。
·There are many passengers lined up at the airport gate.
593

有许多乘客在机场大门处排队。
·The airport is busy with passengers today.
今天机场繁忙，有很多乘客。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: She has stopped to chat with some others.
She is looking into the store window.
She is checking out some items in the rack.
She has placed her bag down next to her.
questions.script:
（A）She has stopped to chat with some others.
（B）She is looking into the store window.
（C）She is checking out some items in the rack.
（D）She has placed her bag down next to her.
（A）她停了下来去和其他人聊天。
（B）她正在朝商店的橱窗里张望。
（C）她正在查看架子上的一些商品。
（D）她把包放在自己旁边。
·A woman is looking at some goods outdoors.
一位女士正在看屋外的一些商品。
·She is browsing through the rack.
她正在浏览货架。
·She is standing with her bag on her shoulder.
她正站着，肩上背着包。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: The cabinet doors are open.
The woman is fixing a dish.
The woman is drinking some water.
There are dishes piled up in the sink.
questions.script:
（A）The cabinet doors are open.
（B）The woman is fixing a dish.
（C）The woman is drinking some water.
（D）There are dishes piled up in the sink.
（A）橱柜的门开着。
（B）女士在做菜。
（C）女士在喝水。
（D）许多盘子堆放在洗碗池里。
·The woman is at the kitchen sink.
女士正在厨房的洗碗池边。
·She is holding something in her hand.
她手里正拿着东西。
·There are bowls placed on the kitchen counter.
厨房的台子上放着一些碗。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: She's reading to a large audience. 594
She's standing in front of the art gallery.
She's looking for a place to sit.
She's by herself in the gallery.
questions.script:
（A）She's reading to a large audience.
594

（B）She's standing in front of the art gallery.
（C）She's looking for a place to sit.
（D）She's by herself in the gallery.
（A）她正对一大群听众朗读。
（B）她正站在艺术画廊前。
（C）她正在找坐的地方。
（D）她独自在画廊。
·She is holding a notepad in front of her.
她面前放着一个笔记本。
·There are paintings hung on the walls.
墙上挂着很多画。
·The girl is standing in an art gallery.
女孩正站在一个艺术画廊里。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: The man is locking up his bicycle.
Some cars are parked near the curb.
The man is waiting for the traffic light to change.
There are trees along the road.
questions.script:
（A）The man is locking up his bicycle.
（B）Some cars are parked near the curb.
（C）The man is waiting for the traffic light to change.
（D）There are trees along the road.
（A）男士正在锁他的自行车。
（B）路边停着一些汽车。
（C）男士正在等交通灯变色。
（D）沿路有许多树。
·A man is riding his bicycle along the road.
一位男士正沿着马路骑自行车。
·The traffic is flowing very smoothly.
交通非常顺畅。
·There are cars on the road today.
今天路上有汽车。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: People are looking into the aquarium.
People are waiting to go into the pool.
People are swimming in a pool.
People are watching a movie.
questions.script:
（A）People are looking into the aquarium.
（B）People are waiting to go into the pool.
（C）People are swimming in a pool.
（D）People are watching a movie.
（A）人们在朝水族馆里看。
595

（B）人们在等着进入游泳池。
（C）人们在游泳池里游泳。
（D）人们在看电影。
·They are looking at the same thing.
他们在看同样的东西。
·The people are standing next to the aquarium.
人们正站在水族馆旁边。
·A couple of the women are carrying bags on their shoulders.
一些女士肩上背着包。
注：在Part 1中，每道试题都添加了3种可能的正确表达方式，考生可
以了解对于同样的照片可能出现的不同表达。

questions.question: Where can I catch the train for Chicago?
options: In one hour.
At Stop 6.
Yes, you can. 我在哪里能搭到开往芝加哥的火车？
questions.script:
Where can I catch the train for Chicago?
（A）In one hour.
（B）At Stop 6.
（C）Yes, you can.
我在哪里能搭到开往芝加哥的火车？
（A）在一小时内。
（B）在6号站台。
（C）是的，你可以。
Q Where does the train for Chicago stop?
A Go line up at Gate 6.
开往芝加哥的火车停在哪里？
—到6号站台去排队。

questions.question: Have the boxes been sent out yet?
options: Once a day.
Yes, they've been delivered.
In the storage room. 那些箱子发送出去了吗？
questions.script:
Have the boxes been sent out yet?
（A）Once a day.
（B）Yes, they've been delivered.
（C）In the storage room.
那些箱子发送出去了吗？
（A）一天一次。
（B）是的，它们已经被运走了。
（C）在储物间里。
Q Have the boxes been shipped out yet?
596

A Yes, they went out this morning.
那些箱子已经用船运走了吗？
—是的，它们是今早发走的。

questions.question: Who is scheduled to speak first?
options: He is the keynote speaker.
Linda Evans is the first on the list.
They are scheduled to arrive soon. 按计划谁应该先发言？
questions.script:
Who is scheduled to speak first?
（A）He is the keynote speaker.
（B）Linda Evans is the first on the list.
（C）They are scheduled to arrive soon.
按计划谁应该先发言？
（A）他是主讲人。
（B）琳达·埃文斯是名单上的第一个人。
（C）按计划他们很快就会到了。
Q Who is due to give a speech now?
A Linda Evans is scheduled to go up.
现在应该谁演讲？
—按计划琳达·埃文斯应该上去。

questions.question: Where do you want me to put these dishes?
options: Just place them next to me.
Yes, it is my favorite.
We're going to the restaurant. 你想让我把这些菜放在哪儿？
questions.script:
Where do you want me to put these dishes?
（A）Just place them next to me.
（B）Yes, it is my favorite.
（C）We're going to the restaurant.
你想让我把这些菜放在哪儿？
（A）把它们放我旁边就行。
（B）是的，它是我最喜欢的。
（C）我们打算去餐馆。
Q Where do these dishes go?
A Put them here beside me.
这些菜放在哪里？
—把它们放在我旁边。

questions.question: Does this total include sales tax?
options: Yes, we're taking a taxi.
No, they don't sell it there.
Yes, I believe it does. 这个总额包括营业税吗？
questions.script:
Does this total include sales tax?
（A）Yes, we're taking a taxi.
（B）No, they don't sell it there.
（C）Yes, I believe it does.
这个总额包括营业税吗？
597

（A）是的，我们打算打车。
（B）不，他们不在那里出售它。
（C）是的，我认为是这样的。
Q Is sales tax included in this bill?
A Yes, it's included in the total.
这个账单里包括营业税吗？
—是的，它包含在总额中了。
注：在Part 2中，为帮助考生提高听懂题目的能力，添加了和试题相同
或相似的表达方法。

questions.question: When do you plan on taking off?
options: This Friday.
Yes, of course.
No, turn it on. 你打算什么时候动身？
questions.script:
When do you plan on taking off?
（A）This Friday.
（B）Yes, of course.
（C）No, turn it on.
你打算什么时候动身？
（A）这周五。
（B）好的，当然可以。
（C）不，把它打开。
Q When will you leave?
A At the end of this week.
你将在什么时候离开？
—这周末。

questions.question:
Can you come into the meeting room to give us a hand, or are you too busy
right now?
options: I could spare a few minutes.
I think there is plenty of room.
Yes, I can lend you one. 如果你不是太忙的话，可以到会议室来给我们帮下忙吗？
questions.script:
Can you come into the meeting room to give us a hand, or are you too busy
right now?
（A）I could spare a few minutes.
（B）I think there is plenty of room.
（C）Yes, I can lend you one.
如果你不是太忙的话，可以到会议室来给我们帮下忙吗？
（A）我可以腾出几分钟。
（B）我觉得有足够的空间。
（C）好的，我可以借给你一个。
Q Could you lend me a hand with something in the meeting room, or are you
tied up at the moment?
598

A I'm free until ten o'clock.
你现在时间紧吗？可以到会议室帮我个忙吗？
—我10点以前都有空。

questions.question: Caroline is planning to take the job in New York, isn't she?
options: I think she's still considering her options.
It was not planned properly to begin with.
They're yours, aren't they? 卡罗琳打算接受纽约的那份工作，是吗？
questions.script:
Caroline is planning to take the job in New York, isn't she?
（A）I think she's still considering her options.
（B）It was not planned properly to begin with.
（C）They're yours, aren't they?
卡罗琳打算接受纽约的那份工作，是吗？
（A）我认为她现在仍在考虑她的选择。
（B）还没有合理地计划好来实施它。
（C）它们是你的，不是吗？
Q Caroline did accept the offer she got from New York, didn't she?
A She is still thinking it over.
卡罗琳确实接受了纽约那份工作，是吗？
—她仍在仔细考虑。

questions.question: Why is it taking such a long time for the food to get here?
options: We only ordered ten minutes ago.
The chicken is their best dish.
Let's just eat here and go. 为什么这么久才把食物送过来？
questions.script:
Why is it taking such a long time for the food to get here?
（A）We only ordered ten minutes ago.
（B）The chicken is their best dish.
（C）Let's just eat here and go.
为什么这么久才把食物送过来？
（A）我们10分钟前才点的餐。
（B）鸡肉是他们最好的菜。
（C）我们就在这里吃完再走吧。
Q What is happening with the food we ordered?
A It's probably on its way now.
我们点的食物怎么样了？
—也许正被送过来。

questions.question: I'm quite certain that we've met somewhere, haven't we?
options: I know where it is, too.
Yes, you do look familiar.
He is sure about it. 我很确信我们在什么地方见过，对吗？
questions.script:
I'm quite certain that we've met somewhere, haven't we?
（A）I know where it is, too.
（B）Yes, you do look familiar.
（C）He is sure about it.
我很确信我们在什么地方见过，对吗？
599

（A）我也知道它在哪里。
（B）是的，你确实看起来面熟。
（C）他对此很确信。
Q We do know each other, don't we?
A Yes, I'm quite sure we've met somewhere before.
我们的确认识彼此，不是吗？
—是的，我非常确定我们以前在哪里见过。

questions.question: Why did the president put off the meeting for another day?
options: No, I have not met with him yet.
The conference room is on this floor.
He had to attend to something urgent. 为什么总裁把会议推迟到了另一天？
questions.script:
Why did the president put off the meeting for another day?
（A）No, I have not met with him yet.
（B）The conference room is on this floor.
（C）He had to attend to something urgent.
为什么总裁把会议推迟到了另一天？
（A）不，我还没有见到他。
（B）会议室在这一层。
（C）他不得不处理紧急事件。
Q Do you know why the big boss postponed the meeting?
A He was needed elsewhere.
你知道大老板为什么将会议推迟了吗？
—其他地方需要他。

questions.question: Are you full, or would you like seconds?
options: No, I'll take the first one.
That would be all right.
Thanks, but I'm full. 你吃饱了吗，要不要再来一些？
questions.script:
Are you full, or would you like seconds?
（A）No, I'll take the first one.
（B）That would be all right.
（C）Thanks, but I'm full.
你吃饱了吗，要不要再来一些？
（A）不，我要吃第一个。
（B）那将很好。
（C）谢谢，我已经吃饱了。
Q Would you like more food, or are you okay?
A I can't eat another bite, thanks.
你吃饱了吗？还需要更多食物吗？
—我已经吃得很饱了，谢谢。

questions.question:
When is Paul due to arrive here?
600
options: No, he has not handed it in yet.
Next month is the deadline.
Let me call him to find out. 保罗应该什么时候到这里？
questions.script:
When is Paul due to arrive here?
600

（A）No, he has not handed it in yet.

保罗应该什么时候到这里？

A I'll phone and ask him.

—我会打电话问他的。

questions.question: Would you mind holding the door open for me?
options: Of course. Here you go.
Oh, it's probably closed.
No, it's being held another time. 你介意帮我扶下门让它开着吗？
questions.script:
Would you mind holding the door open for me?
（A）Of course. Here you go.
（B）Oh, it's probably closed.
（C）No, it's being held another time.
你介意帮我扶下门让它开着吗？
（A）当然可以，您这边请。
（B）噢，它可能关了。
（C）不，它将在其他时间举行。

A Yes, of course.
你可以帮我扶下门让它开着吗？
—好的，当然可以。

questions.question: The rain is expected to come down hard this weekend, isn't it?
options: Yes, he is waiting for it now.
Yes, but I won't be here.
To get away for a while. 这周末会下大雨，是吗？
questions.script:
The rain is expected to come down hard this weekend, isn't it?
（A）Yes, he is waiting for it now.
（B）Yes, but I won't be here.
（C）To get away for a while.
这周末会下大雨，是吗？
（A）是的，他现在正在等它。
（B）是的，不过到时我不在这里。
（C）离开一会儿。
Q There is rain in the forecast for this weekend, isn't there?
601

A Yes, but I am going away.
天气预报说这周末会下雨，是吗？
—是的，不过我要离开了。

questions.question: What was that you said again, Mr. Carlson?
options: Sorry, I am not sure where Mr. Carlson is.
Yes, she said it several times already.
I said you should send them a check. 卡尔森先生，您刚才又说了一遍什么？
questions.script:
What was that you said again, Mr. Carlson?
（A）Sorry, I am not sure where Mr. Carlson is.
（B）Yes, she said it several times already.
（C）I said you should send them a check.
卡尔森先生，您刚才又说了一遍什么？
（A）抱歉，我不清楚卡尔森先生在哪里。
（B）是的，她已经说过几遍了。
（C）我说你应该给他们寄一张支票。
Q Could you please repeat that again, Mr. Carlson?
A Mail a check to his address.
卡尔森先生，您可以重复一遍吗？
—往他的地址邮寄一张支票。

questions.question: Did your staff win the game at the company picnic?
options: We have been doing fine.
It got rained out.
That's what he said. 你的员工在公司野餐时赢得比赛了吗？
questions.script:
Did your staff win the game at the company picnic?
（A）We have been doing fine.
（B）It got rained out.
（C）That's what he said.
你的员工在公司野餐时赢得比赛了吗？
（A）我们一直做得很好。
（B）那时外面下雨了。
（C）那正是他所说的。

A We didn't play because it rained.
你的员工在公司野餐时举行的比赛中表现如何？
—下雨了，我们就没玩。

questions.question: I thought the movie was very moving, didn't you?
options: Yes, it was very touching.
Let's go to the theater later.
We're moving out next week. 我觉得这部电影很感人，你不这么认为吗？
questions.script:
I thought the movie was very moving, didn't you?
（A）Yes, it was very touching.
（B）Let's go to the theater later.
（C）We're moving out next week.
我觉得这部电影很感人，你不这么认为吗？
602

（A）是的，电影非常感人。
（B）咱们待会儿一起去电影院吧。
（C）我们下周搬家。
Q Didn't you think the movie was very emotional?
A Yes, I nearly cried.
难道你不认为这部电影很感人吗？
—是啊，我都快哭了。

questions.question: I was told by a friend of mine that you carry old comic books here.
options: Go and speak to that man wearing the cap.
I'm sorry, but those are too heavy to be carried.
Yes, the bookstore is across the road. 我的一个朋友告诉我，你这里有旧的连环漫画册出售。
questions.script:
I was told by a friend of mine that you carry old comic books here.
（A）Go and speak to that man wearing the cap.
（B）I'm sorry, but those are too heavy to be carried.
（C）Yes, the bookstore is across the road.
我的一个朋友告诉我，你这里有旧的连环漫画册出售。
（A）去和那位戴帽子的男士说吧。
（B）我很抱歉，那些东西太重了，搬不动。
（C）是的，书店在马路对面。

A Yes, the clerk over there will help you find them.
我听说你们这里有旧连环画的存货。
—是的，那边的店员会帮你找到它们。

questions.question: How do you commute to work from your place?
options: Yes, I am doing great.
I'm not familiar with the area.
I usually drive my car. 你怎么从住处去上班？
questions.script:
How do you commute to work from your place?
（A）Yes, I am doing great.
（B）I'm not familiar with the area.
（C）I usually drive my car.
你怎么从住处去上班？
（A）是的，我做得很棒。
（B）我对这个地方不熟悉。
（C）我通常自己开车去。
Q How do you get to work every morning?
A I bought a car recently.
你每天早晨怎么去上班？
—我最近买了一部车。

questions.question:
Don't you think you should study the map before we leave?
603
options: Don't worry, I know the area well.
I've already studied for the test.
Why don't we take off soon? 难道你不认为你应该在我们离开之前研究一下地图吗？
questions.script:
Don't you think you should study the map before we leave?
603

（A）Don't worry, I know the area well.
（B）I've already studied for the test.
（C）Why don't we take off soon?
难道你不认为你应该在我们离开之前研究一下地图吗？
（A）不用担心，我对该地区很熟悉。
（B）我已经为这次考试学习过了。
（C）为什么我们不尽快离开？

A It's okay. I've been there many times before.
我们在出发前应该研究一下地图吧？
—没问题。我已经去过那里很多次了。

questions.question: Can you tell John to come and see me when he steps into the office?
options: Yes, he stepped out a minute ago.
I think he went to see his doctor.
I don't think he's coming back today. 约翰到办公室的时候你让他过来找我好吗？
questions.script:
Can you tell John to come and see me when he steps into the office?
（A）Yes, he stepped out a minute ago.
（B）I think he went to see his doctor.
（C）I don't think he's coming back today.
约翰到办公室的时候你让他过来找我好吗？
（A）是的，他刚刚出去。
（B）我想他是去看医生了。
（C）我想他今天不会回来了。

A He is not coming back to the office today.
约翰露面的时候你可以让他来这里吗？
—他今天不会回办公室了。

questions.question: Who is the person in charge of our Hong Kong branch?
options: Yes, Ms. Wong was born there.
To learn how to speak Chinese.
Let me find out for you. 谁主管我们香港分公司呢？

Who is the person in charge of our Hong Kong branch?
（A）Yes, Ms. Wong was born there.

谁主管我们香港分公司呢？
（A）是的，翁女士出生在那里。

604

谁是我们香港分公司的负责人呢？
—我会帮你查一下。

questions.question: Perhaps we should call to reserve the tables for this evening.
options: Thank you. It was a delicious meal.
I think that may be a wise thing to do.
That would be a table for a party of six. 也许我们应该打电话预订今晚的席位。

（B）I think that may be a wise thing to do.
（C）That would be a table for a party of six.

I'd like to welcome you all to this creative writing seminar. We have some

wonderful activities for you this evening. The program tonight has been

wonderful novel The Smiths and the winner of the Franklin Award for
Literature last year. （78）Before John begins the session, I'd like to say a few
words about his life. Born in a small, country town in the southwest, he had
difficulty finding friends. He began writing at an early age and was soon winning
prizes for his poetry and short stories. I can't think of a better person to speak
to us tonight about creativity. （79）So please welcome John Walkley.

精彩小说《史密斯一家》的作者，也是去年富兰克林文学奖的获得者。在约
翰开始这次会议之前，我想先介绍一下他的生平。他出生在西南部的一个乡
村小镇，在那里他很难找到朋友。他很早就开始写作了，并且他的诗歌和短
篇小说很快就为他赢得不少奖项。我想不出今晚还有谁能比他更适合给我们

Questions 86 through 88 refer to the following report.
This is Francis Kelly live from Collins Street with an update on the annual St.
Patrick's Day parade. Right now I can see the first floats of the parade
proceeding down Collins Street（86）between George and Pitt Street. The
warm and sunny conditions today have drawn out the crowds in record
numbers. （87）Police have estimated the crowd to be more than 100,000. Police
have warned that anyone coming to the parade should not approach via either
George or Pitt Streets. These roads are now completely blocked, and the police are
no longer letting anybody pass the barriers. Police advise that any spectators
arriving now should proceed towards Federation Square, （88）which is not
yet completely filled.
这是弗朗西斯·凯利从柯林斯街发回的有关年度圣帕特里克节游行的最
新现场报道。现在我可以看到游行的第一批花车沿着柯林斯街在乔治街和皮
特街之间行进。今天阳光充足且温暖，这种天气吸引的游行人数创下了历史
纪录。警方估计游行人数超过了10万人。警方警告参加游行的人不要经由乔
治街或皮特街到达那里。这些街道现在已经完全堵塞，警方也不再让任何人
通过路障。他们建议现在到达的观众朝联盟广场行进，这个广场现在还没有
爆满。

Questions 89 through 91 refer to the following weather report.
We'd like to start our evening news bulletin with a special report. The weather
bureau has issued a special warning regarding an approaching dust storm. The
unusually dry weather which we've been experiencing over the last three months
has combined with strong northeasterly winds to produce a massive dust storm,
which is moving steadily towards our city. The thick clouds should hit the
northwestern suburbs by about 9:00 a.m. tomorrow morning（89）and then
gradually move across the city in a southeasterly direction. The weather bureau
advises all residents to make no unnecessary trips tomorrow, as visibility will
641

be extremely reduced. （90）Schools and government offices will, however, be
open tomorrow. Anyone with asthma or any other breathing disorder should
remain indoors （91）and keep doors and windows tightly closed.
我们想以一则特别报道来开始晚间新闻快报。气象局对即将到来的沙尘
暴发布了特别警告。过去三个月来，我们一直经历的不寻常的干燥天气与强
劲的东北风一同形成了一场巨大的沙尘暴，这场沙尘暴现在正在平稳地朝我
市移动。乌云将在明天上午9点到达西北部郊区，然后会逐步向东南方向移
动并穿过城市。因为空气能见度将大大降低，所以气象局建议所有居民取消
不必要的出行。但学校和政府部门仍将开放。有哮喘及其他呼吸系统疾病的
人应该待在室内，并且将门窗紧闭。

Questions 92 through 94 refer to the following talk.
Welcome, everybody, to this staff meeting. （92）I have to add a new item
to the agenda since I received several complaints yesterday about the state of the
lunchroom. I'm not going to name anybody at this meeting, but I have to say
that I, too, am also disappointed by the behavior of certain staff members.
（94）The lunchroom is a shared facility and one which provides all of us with
a valuable service. Let's keep it clean!（93）If you make a mess, clean it up. If
you read the newspaper, return it to the table folded neatly when you have finished
with it. If you use the sink, make sure you leave it clean. This is a question of basic
good manners, and I hope I never have to speak to anybody here again about
it!（94）
欢迎大家来参加这次员工会议。昨天我收到了几份关于餐厅状况的投

名字，但是我也不得不说，我本人也对某些员工的表现感到失望。餐厅是一

Questions 95 through 97 refer to the following news report and map.
It's time for an update on the local economy. Thanks to the efforts of Mayor
Crawford, several companies have opened branches in Richmond during the past
year. That's been great for the economy as unemployment is at a record low.
（95）However, there's a housing shortage now, so the average price of a house
has risen by more than twenty percent this year. This morning, Carter
Construction announced it's building an apartment complex on the eastern side
of the Mohawk River. It will be adjacent to the Danforth Bridge.
（96）Construction won't be complete until eighteen months from now,
（97）but when it's done, more than 600 family-sized units will be available for
rent or purchase.
是时候给当地经济注入新动力了。得益于克劳福德市长的努力，过去一
年来，很多企业都在里士满开设了分支机构。这对于经济来说意义重大，因
为失业率创下历史最低点。然而，由于当下住房紧张，今年的房价平均上涨
了20%以上。就在今天早上，卡特建设公司宣布要在莫华克河东岸建一栋公
寓大楼。大楼将与丹福斯大桥毗邻。整个建设工期将历时18个月，且大楼一
经建成，将有600多套家庭住宅可供租赁或购买。
